author: {'steamid': '76561197978742688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1560621572}
review:
Der Kern des Radsportmanagers ist das Rennen selber, und hier glänzt das Spiel. 
Wer sich in die Taktik eines Radsportrennens (und da gibt es tatsächlich recht viel zu bedenken von Start bis Ziel) reinarbeiten möchte und spannende Rennen fahren will, mal mit dem eigenen Team wirklich die Tour de France gewinnen möchte, der möge einen Blick riskieren.

Zwar kauft man Fahrer, stellt ein Team zusammen, sollte auf Finanzen, Training, Sponsoren und deren Ziele ein Auge haben und kann sich richtig in das Mikromanagement des Teams reinfuchsen, um noch bessere Leistungen am Renntag abrufen zu können. Aber im Endeffekt kann man auch einfach gleich loslegen und sofort Rennen fahren, da das Spiel auch ohne großes Eingreifen zumindest in der ersten Saison gut spielbar ist und für eine überwiegend fitte Truppe am Renntag sorgt. Legt man selbst noch kundige Hand an, sind natürlich ein paar Siege mehr möglich.

Im Endeffekt wird aber auf dem Sattel entschieden, und da, wo es darauf ankommt, macht dieses Spiel seit Jahren die Sache einfach nur richtig. Jedes Jahr - ich bin unregelmäßiger Käufer und kaufe eher die billigere, veraltete Version alle paar Jahre - wird leicht verbessert, es wird etwas realistischer, geschmeidiger... Besonders schön finde ich in dieser Version (2016) die Möglichkeit den Fahrern eine Strategie mitzugeben, die sie so ungefähr befolgen, das vereinfacht das Mikromanagement von bis zu 10 Fahrern gleichzeitig. So kann man sich schön in den entsprechenden Rennabschnitten um die wichtigsten Fahrer selber kümmern und der Rest macht trotzdem nicht unfassbaren Mist.
Die Rennen machen einfach Spaß, mit wenigen Befehlen sind die Fahrer zu beherrschen, und dennoch passieren immer wieder unvorhergesehene Dinge. Da reisst mal das halbe Feld ab, weil sie die Windkante trifft, der Topfahrer hat einen Platten, unter den Ausreissern befand sich leider einer, der überragende Form hatte usw. 
Das Gute ist, es gibt immer etwas zu tun und zu verbessern, und wenn man scheitert, kann man sich im Replay gut angucken, wo man es verbockt hat, zu früh angegriffen, die falsche Taktik hatte... Wenn man aber alles richtig gemacht hat und noch gewinnt (was auch nicht so einfach ist, denn andere Teams machen auch manchmal alles richtig), ist es dann natürlich um so schöner.
Jedes Team, das mitfährt, hat wie man selber bestimmte Ziele. Der eine will die Gesamtwertung gewinnen, das andere Team ist nu auf Sprint-Etappen scharf, das nächste hat sich vorgenommen die Bergwertung zu gewinnen und wird ganz fuchsig, sobald ein anderer ausreisst. Das macht die Rennen wunderbar abwechslungsreich, da man selbst zwar eigene Ziele hat, die der anderen Teams aber nicht kennt und so immer wieder (meist unangenehm) überrascht wird.
Ein Rennen dauert genau richtig lange, also nicht so lange wie in Wirklichkeit, aber lang genug um das Gefühl einer angen Etappe gut einzufangen. Es gibt aber auch eine Zeit-Beschleunigungs-Funktion, gerne im eher langweiligen Mittelteil angewandt, wenn sich Ausreissergruppen gebildet haben, aber die Jagd noch nicht wirklich Fahrt aufnehmen will..

Gameplay-mäßig bekommt das Spiel im Rennteil eine Eins, und das ist das Wichtigste.

Abstriche sind bei der Grafik zu machen, die ist befriedigend bis ausreichend, von grottenhässlichen Standbild-Zuschauern Marke Potemkin'sches Dorf (manche bewegen sich allerdings auch und laufen wie die Blöden den Fahrern wie im Fernsehen genau vors Vorderrad) über eigentlich recht hübsche Bauwerke am Straßenrand, geklonte Fahrer, die sich nur durch Trikot und Größe unterscheiden bis zu recht netten Animationen, wenn dem Fahrer die Puste ausgeht.... ist da alles so määäääh, passt schon... Am unangenehmsten sind mir die Klonfahrer, also ein bisschen mehr Abwechslung in den Gesichtern wäre schön. Das fällt hier eigentlich nur bei den Siegerehrungen auf, da im Rennen die Gesichter der Fahrer so ziemlichd as Uninteressantete ever sind, aber einen Klon nach dem anderen auf dem Treppchen zu sehen, ist schon mager. Vor allem weil man auf die Siege doch so stolz ist. Es gab mal für nen alten Teil so eine Mod, da hatte (u.a.) wenigstens Tom Boonen eine verpixelte Kokain-Visage, aber für diesen Teil bin ich noch nicht fündig geworden.

Den Oscar für besten Score und Sound gibt's auch nicht, da hat man sich doch sehr zurückgehalten, die Musik dudelt angenehm unaufgeregt vor sich hin, Freunde von Fahrstuhlmusik kommen hier auf ihre Kosten, aber im Feld ist mir da einfach zu wenig Geräuschkulisse. Mal jubelt einer verzagt, die Rädchen sirren, aber da geht eindeutig noch mehr.

Bugs mag der ein oder andere finden, bei mir stürzt das Spiel ab und zu mal ab (alle 10 Rennen circa), aber bis jetzt musste ich nur eine Etappe wiederholen, da es ansosnten entweder im Ladebildschirm fürs Rennen, einmal im Manager und mehrfach direkt nach dem Rennen abstürzte. Da war das Problem dank der guten Save-Funktion (die anscheinend direkt hinter der Ziellinie schon das Ergebnis speichert) eher gering und mit einem Neustart des Spiels schnell behoben, und das Ergebnis des Rennens immer gespeichert, musste also nicht wiederholt werden.  Es hat mir also nicht die Laune am Spiel verdorben oder ich sitze zitternd davor, es möge nicht abstürzen, dann gäbe es auch keinen Daumen hoch. 
Vorsicht ist hier natürlich mit den runterladbaren Datensätzen aus dem Workshop zu beachten, ich habe extra nur eine sehr kleine Real Name-Database genommen, um Problemen vorzubeugen durch 200 zusätzliche Etappen und 400 spielbare Teams usw. für noch mehr Bug-Frust zu sorgen.
Meiner Meinung ist im Spiel genug selber drinnen, hunderte Rennen, Teams bis in die Dritte Liga, also da hab ich auch so genug.

Im Endeffekt macht jedes Rennen so viel Spaß, übrigens, auch ohne der super-Radsportfan zu sein, dass ich das Spiel empfehle. Eine der besseren Simulationen eines Sports. Die Frage ist halt, ob man mit Radrennen überhaupt was anfangen kann. Sie sind durchaus spannender als man denkt. Was dieses Spiel exzellent rüberbringt.

review:
2015 oyununa nazaran kesinlikle güzel bir ilerleme katetmiş. Kariyer modunda oyun çok daha akıcı, yarış simülasyonları 2015 oyununa göre çok daha seri. Pro Cycling Manager'da beğendiğim bir diğer nokta ise hemen hemen her oyunlarında aynı arayüzü kullanıyor olmaları, oyuna yeni başlayan eski PCM oyuncularını kesinlikle zorlamıyor bu yönüyle. Asıl yenilik ise steam workshop'ın seriye gelmesi oldu. Bunun haricinde geçmiş yarışların sonuçlarına bakarken belli filtreler getirildi, sadece sizin takımınızın sonuçları veya herhangi bir takımın sonuçlarına rahatlıkla erişebiliyorsunuz. Eski oyunlarda bunun için sıralamayı takım ismine göre yapıyordunuz ve listede aşağıya doğru inerek takımınızın ismini buluyordunuz, bu konuda yenilikçi olmasa da kullanıcı dostu bir yönteme gidilmiş. Diğer bir yenilik ise oyuna koleksiyonlar gelmiş ancak pek inceleme fırsatım olmadı çünkü bunların erişimi kapatılmış yeni oyun çıktıktan sonra. Aslında bu oyunu almak yerine 2017'yi almayı düşünüyordum ancak geçenlerde 2016'yı bir dükkanda on liraya görünce dayanamayıp aldım kutulu şekilde. Oyunu açıkçası tavsiye ederim, 2015'e göre crash vermemesi ve simülasyonların hızı kesinlikle oyunu oynanır kılıyor. Tabi bir de 2017'de olmayan sevdiğimiz bisikletçilerin bu oyunda var olması da oynamak için bir sebep olabilir. :(

Edit: Asıl oyunu en oynanabilir kılan şeyi söylemeyi unuttum. Bir sonraki yarışa kadar simüle ederken oyunu aşağıya attığınızda buna devam ediyor. 2015 oyununda oyunu aşağı attığınızda devam etmiyordu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005452602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13107, 'last_played': 1497352085}
review:
I don't normally do Reviews. But this one I thought i needed to as they are about to relaese a new version of this game. 

Firstly, I am a massive cycling fan and I ONLY recommend this for massive cycling fans and ONLY for the Be a Pro mode. Although i do play career mode, there just isnt enough content in it to recommend it. After being a lifelong player of game like Football Manager, this career mode isseriously bland and there is little depth too it. 

I realise it doesnt have the same budget as a game like FM, but small improvements could be made to make it more realistic, like the BIG stars not moving teams every year, and the teams chaning strip and sponsors EVERY year etc. On that, there is no license, thank fuck for the guys who make real world names/jerseys/stats etc. Without the workshop content, i would not play this game. 

CRASHES CRASHES CRASHES.... and not the bike kind... this game crashes more than any game i have ever played before. Even the pop up to report the crash.... crashes. I shit you not. These crashes have literally happen on the same race/stage EVERY time you try to play it, it is completely unacceptable for them NOT to have fixed these. 

In saying that though, this is all we cycling fans have. I have over 200hrs in the game and will probably put in another 200 before i buy the next one. In itself, it is a reat game, and the Be A Pro mode makes you want to keep playing to better your rider so you can take on the big boys and the big races. 

I will buy the next version of the game when its out in the blind hope that they place more depth into the Be A Pro mode, as the career mode hasnt changed in 4 or 5 years. Heres hoping. 

If you are a cycling nerd then i recommend. If you are a fan of "manager" type games, then i DO NOT recommend this game as there are simply too many bugs and not enough depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174919106', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5450, 'last_played': 1521283664}
review:
[b][u][i]TL;DR[/i][/u][/b]

[i]It's the only cycling manager game around and it has a few issues here and there (like CTDs in Paris-Roubaix on above Medium Graphics settings, not being able to continue past the World Championships date if you're not careful when selecting your team), but all in all it's a fun and relaxing game which, if you like cycling, can provide many hours of gameplay. If you catch it on sale, I definitely recommend it.[/i]

----

Tried to play Paris-Roubaix with Team Lotto Jumbo (for Sep Vanmarcke). Crashed midway through the race 3 times out of 3 attempts. The game, not Sep, fortunately. :)

I guess we'll never know if he'll win it, because I'm not gonna spend any more time with this. Or probably any other future release, unless they can actually make a game that runs. Even for one single race would be an improvement. Until then, it's back to PCM 2013 for me, that one's always been stable, so far.

If this game would not crash every time, I guess it'd be pretty good, but you can't tell if it's gonna work or not until you actually try it on your machine, so it's a gamble. If you're feeling lucky give it a shot, otherwise don't bother.

[b][i]A FEW HOURS LATER...[/i][/b]

So I've said earlier I wasn't gonna spend any more time with this, but since I had the day off and Support was quick to reply to my ticket, I followed their suggestions and did this:

[quote]
A. Please check that Pro Cycling Manager 2016 is correctly installed:

1. Run Steam and click LIBRARY.
2. Right click on 'Pro Cycling Manager 2016' and click 'Properties'.
3. Click the tab 'LOCAL FILES' then click the button 'VERIFY INTEGRITY OF GAME CACHE'.


B. Please configure Pro Cycling Manager 2016 in administrator mode at startup:

1. Run Steam and click LIBRARY.
2. Right click on 'Pro Cycling Manager 2016' and click 'Properties'.
3. Click the tab 'LOCAL FILES' then the button 'BROWSE LOCAL FILES'.
4. Right click on the application 'PCM' (PCM.exe) and click 'Troubleshoot compatibility'.
5. Click 'Troubleshoot program' then check 'The program requires additional permissions' and click the button 'Next'.
6. Click the button 'Test the program...'.
7. Quit the game and click the button 'Next'.
8. Click 'Yes, save these settings for this program' then click the button 'Close'.
[/quote]

Now I made it to the finish line in Paris-Roubaix (sadly only 8th for Sep :P), but just as all the riders crossed the line it crashed again. It's something, but what I said before stands: it seems to be a particular buggy / capricious game and you can't be sure it'll work for you unless you try it. Technical issues aside, it would be a good game, but with all these crashes I can't recommend it.

[b][i]AND FINALLY...[/i][/b]

After doing this:

[quote]
C. Please configure the graphics settings to Medium:

1. Run PCM16
2. Click on the Options icon (gear) from bottom left.
3. Click the tab 'Display device' et select the preset 'Medium'.
4. Click on the button 'Save Changes' and restart the game.
[/quote]

I finally managed to finish Paris-Roubaix and also get to the Podium and Results screens, basically completing the race. And not crash to desktop. And beat Degenkolb in a sprint. With Sep Vanmarcke. :D

Ironically, after all these tweaks and technical issues, it makes finally completing a race (victorious on top) even more rewarding. But still not recommended. After almost a year since release and a handful of patches, the game should not be as unstable and picky about configurations as it is. When I got it I was hoping the patches would have sorted out most of the stability issues that people were complaining about (and which put me off of purchasing it earlier), but it's disappointing to see that I have to run it on Medium settings and keep my fingers crossed just to have a shot at actually completing a race. Maybe I'm just unlucky and stumbled upon some kind of incompatibility related particularly to my machine, but this is definitely the most buggy / unstable game I've played in a while.

If you're a cycling fan and catch it on a (massive) discount, then get it and see how it works for you. But don't put your hopes up too high.

[b][i]MANY HOURS LATER...[/i][/b]

I've decided to start a career and the game went quite well, a couple of seasons in. Simulated some races, went 3D in many others, the crash on (Very) High Graphics settings appeared in Paris-Roubaix only, changed back to Medium and didn't have an issue with that since.

Found a few other quirks here and there (for example be careful when picking your National Team riders, make sure the check mark is selected in front of them, not the question mark, or you'll risk being unable to continue past the World Championships date and the only way around this is to load a previous auto-save), but all in all the good outweighs the bad and the game is quite fun and relaxing. Initially I didn't recommend it, but to be fair, given the many hours I've spent playing so far, I'm changing this review to Recommended.

I'm not sure how relevant this is now that PCM 2017 is out, but if you're a cycling fan and catch it on sale or don't yet want to spend more on the latest release (I'd wait for some patches first), this may be a good game for you.

[b][i]Nominated for Steam Awards 2017[/i][/b]

For [i]“The World Is Grim Enough Let's Just All Get Along”[/i] - as I mentioned when I did the review, it can reward you with hours and hours of relaxing, immersive gameplay. Even with all its flaws, if you like cycling this game delivers.

review:
Preis-Leistungs-Mäßig ein Fehler.

Verändert (oder gar verbessert) wurde im Vergleich zum PCM15 kaum etwas, lediglich die Aufmachung ist minimal verändert. Die Rennen sehen leicht hübscher aus. Dafür wurde im Management-Teil etwas Großes verbockt: Ich persönlich bin ein Spieler, der es liebt die Mannschaft voll auszuschöpfen und auch mit den schwächeren Fahrern Ziele anzupeilen und zu erreichen. Das klappt in diesem Teil so gar nicht, da man nur einige wenige Kapitäne vorgeschrieben bekommt und die anderen Fahrer nur Zulieferer sind. Das ist sehr schade und macht den Karriere-Modus nahezu kaputt.

Der Online-Modus funktioniert auch nicht gut. Oft findet man keine Server, oder das Spiel funktioniert nicht richtig.

Ich hoffe der 17er wird besser!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092633924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2472, 'last_played': 1622844037}
review:
The game is quite realistic and enjoyable.

I see many people complain about crashes but i have only had 2 so far, and on re-boot you dont lose any game data, only if in middle of a race you have to restart it, which is not always a bad thing.

The thing that bugs me is the commentator, has about 5 phrases that he repeats every race. could be alot more immersive if they were more like the guys on the telly.

Also your charecter / team earns money but there is no shop to spend the cash in? I mean.. i want to buy upgrades which give my charecter better stats, jerseys, shoes that can be customized.

The riders in the race are somewhat static, i mean, I never see anyone drink water, scratch there ass or grab their nuts cause theyv went numb.. they just sit there with there legs pumping. occasionally stand up.

The safety / team cars drive right through the packs, like ghost cars or something.

even the sound... im in a peleton with 120 other riders... cant hear any hum off the tyres.. that should be deafening.. i should be on here moaning about the tyre noises but im not.

every charecter u make looks like nicholas cage from gone in sixty seconds..

but on the contrary i do enjoy the game and will continue to play it, i just feel this COULD be a 10 with a little more effort put in to really make the viewer / manager feel like they were their and to let them customise and upgrade team / player bikes / attire

review:
I love this game as much as I hate it. With the amount of bugs I have to deal with I should stop playing it long time ago and ask for refund. But the problem is this game is awesome! Yes, despite all problems I love it, particularly career mode.   
The most irritaiting things are:
- game crashes
- log out error during game
- no way to save game in traditional way (which means any problem with your profile save and 5 years of your career is gone)
- grand tour stages omitted/ out of order
- cyclist models blocking themselves in most important moments jet normally being able to ''go through'' each other
- mountain sprint finishes (every mountain stage in grand tour finish in sprint), not worth to attack your gc contender as saving energy for last km is the best play you can make
- breakaways cooperation is strange to say atleast (some riders does't want to relay, few km later they dictate mad pace, etc.)
- cyclist role in simulation mode are awkward to swap
- hilly finishes are weird and valverde takes them 90% of the times (regardless how fast we climbing he still got red bar to sprint at the top of the hill)
- mountain points - everyone in the breakaway wants them, even riders that are not in contention for mountain jersey
- equipment and camps are useless and I am not even bothering to use them
- scouting is broken (regardless of scout reputation reports are still the same)
- riders satisfaction not working properly as leaders are always unhappy

And belive me that's only few I can remember atm. Would be awesome if Cyinide could address some of this issues before adding new features in next year as I really enjoy this game and would recommend it to all cycling fans.

review:
Je précise que je ne joue pas en multi car je suis trop loin du répartiteur et j'ai donc une connection pas top.
Je suis un ancien joueur de la série Pro Cycling manager (je les ai tous acheté depuis le 1er). J'ai moi-même animé une communauté de joueurs sur une version précédente. Bref je ne suis pas arrivé hier et je connais bien la mécanique.
Personnellement je suis très satisfait du jeu. Pour moi c'est le meilleur opus de la série tout simplement.
Voici ce que j'ai aimé :
- le graphisme a été clairement optimisé. Dans la version précédente, avec la même machine je ramais un peu avec des niveaux de détails plus faibles
- l'IA est améliorée : une fois que l'on avait trouvé une tambouille pour les sprint et les étapes de montagne, c'était pas trop compliqué de battre l'IA, désormais le juste équilibre existe entre la capacité propre à l'étape (par exemple montagne), l'endurance, la résistance, la récupération ... alors qu'avant si on attaquait au mauvais endroit tout était foutu, désormais on peut faire de très belles étapes de montagne avec plusieurs attaques successives.
- l'interface de gestion a été améliorée aussi donnant plus de profondeur au jeu, notamment sur le scouting et la formation.
Bien sûr il faut améliorer des choses, notamment encore en gestion, on en cohérence dans la fonction "coureur pro" mais franchement je suis très satisfait de mon achat.

I actually enjoyed the first season of my career. There are some bugs here and there, but nothing game breaking to me.
However, when reaching the second season, I was hugely disappointed. As far as I can see, there are no variants, meaning that ALL stages are the same for all races in 2017, as they were in 2016. Very disappointing and lazy by the game developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022385319', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5557, 'last_played': 1498677207}
review:
Kauftipp für Radsportfans und Interessierte. Für ein Spiel zwischendurch aber sehr komplex. 
Dezente, sinnvolle Verbesserungen gegenüber dem RSM 2015. Taktisches Verhalten der KI im Rennen merklich verbessert. Feld reagiert je nach Stand im Klassement des Fahrers verschieden auf Ausreißversuche, Attacken oder Rennsituationen. 
Der Pro Cyclist Modus wurde im Detail aufgewertet durch die verbesserten Anweisungen der Teamkapitäne - Gewinn an Immersion. Mit der Entwicklung seines Fahrers muss man sich intensiver beschäftigen. Sozio-emotionale Komponenten fehlen - Geld verdienen, aber keine Ausgabemöglichkeiten, kein Privatleben, keine Emotionen. So muss man halt selber in die Fahrerrolle eintauchen. Aber den Fahrer sportlich entwickeln lohnt sich und macht Spass. 
Menüführung und Bedienung geht gut von der Hand. Steuerung des Fahrers im Rennen nicht 100% ideal, weil durch Klick auf eine Anweisung schonmal aus Versehen der Einsatzbalken verschoben wird. Aber dies ist eine Kleinigkeit. Online-Multiplayer und Sammelkarten habe ich bisher nicht genutzt. Daher dazu kein Kommentar.
Wenn man den 2015er RSM besitzt, lohnt der Umstieg nur bedingt. Wer das Geld über hat, holt sich den 2016er und wird sicher glücklich.

review:
En tant que passionné de vélo, je ne pouvais pas passer à côté de ce titre, ni à côté des 10 derniers opus... Je joue à PCM depuis PCM2006, et chaque année, j'y retourne, en espérant trouver ce que j'attends... et j'attends toujours...

Chaque année, nous avons droit à une version brouillon de PCM... Bugs à tout va, incohérences de l'IA, problème de cosmétique, interface à s'arracher les cheveux, fautes dans le texte, toutes ces "petites" choses qui décrédibilisent totalement le jeu ainsi que Cyanide ! Certains bugs existent depuis plusieurs opus, sont remontés mais sont toujours là ! Certains textes ne sont même pas mis à jour d'un opus à l'autre (dans le 2015, j'ai eu le droit à "Bienvenue dans le tutoriel de PCM 2014" !).

Enfin vous l'aurez compris, ce jeu ne vaut en rien son prix, c'est exactement le même nid de bugs, incohérences et autres fonctions non abouties qui nous sont reservis chaque année, avec, histoire de faire passer la douloreuse, quelques "nouveautés", parfois issues d'un opus précédent (certaines fonctions sont supprimées puis resservies comme des nouveautés 2 ou 3 ans plus tard).

Je n'aborderai même pas le mode multijoueur, qui est une vaste blague (coupures, communauté inexistante, etc...)

Bref, même si je retombe dedans chaque année (je suis passionné, donc je fais l'effort de m'adapter), je ne recommanderais en aucun cas PCM tant qu'il sera entre les mains d'une équipe d'incompétents (et je pèse mes mots).

review:
MENUDA FALTA DE RESPETO

En Offline: No hay ni por donde cogerlo, si lo intentas jugar al nivel difícil o extremo. La IA nunca tiene malos días y siempre te saca verdaderas minutadas. La barra de esfuerzo se gasta muy rapidamente, y la IA se puede tirar atacando en un puerto un kilómetro entero. Nuestros corredores pierden posiciones sin sentido alguno. Según el valor aleatorio que tengas de frescura, ya te puedes ir olvidando de un Giro, un Tour o una vuelta, ya puedes gestionarlo perfecto, que siempre te sacarán burradas en cuanto a diferencias. 

El control automático no sirve para nada. El sistema revienta a tus corredores, incluso hasta que, si te despistas, descolgarte del pelotón incluso en llano. 

Tras las actualizaciones, lo único que han hecho es estropearlo más. El agua se gasta en un suspiro, cuando cualquier aficionado al ciclismo sabe, que los corredores profesionales, suelen incluso tirar agua antes de empezar un puerto.

El Online mejoró, pero de que me sirve si sigue crasheando y para colmo, ahora nos tenemos que comer las databases con nombres falsos, cuando en un principio se podía crear con databases descargadas de steam workshop. Esto significaba que con una db modificada, podíamos ver los nombres de los corredores reales completamente, pues los señores de Cyanide lo han capado. 

No lo recomiendo en absoluto. Es increíble ver como ganas a sprinters con Nibali en llano en máximo nivel, y sin embargo siendo el tercer, cuarto o quinto mejor en montaña, aunque estes a +5, terminas perdiendo tiempo igual, da igual que sea Contador, que Froome, que Quintana, da igual en absoluto. 

Paso de jugar a este juego, del que esperaba mucho más y me ha defraudado totalmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992736138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 57536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5109, 'last_played': 1497551119}
review:
Since 2012 I have about 1000+ hours of gaming experience each year with Pro Cycling Manager. I play career mode, pro cyclist mode and multiplayer. 
This is the most exciting cycling game on the market. Despite the fact some of the features are not working yet or need some improvements.

Pro's:
- Multiplayer allows people to rejoin the game after a crash. This wasn't possible in earlier editions.
- Multiplayer: No more teams with Pantani/Armstrong, Contador, Froome, Nibali and Quintana in one team versus 5 copies of that same team, but they use the actual teams.
- Multiplayer: You will be rewarded with more ladder points when you have results with weaker teams.
- Multiplayer: You can play pro cyclist multiplayer!
- Multiplayer: The interface is generally easy to use.
- Multiplayer: chat function works during load screen, and having a friends list showing who's online is nice to have.
- Pro Cyclists: There are objectives per race based on your team role.
- 3D: In earlier editions the mountain and hill stat were based on the type of race. In a mountain race only the mountain stat was used and for flat races only the hill stat. Now it is based on the parcours/route itself, instead of a predetermined number.
- Career mode: more simplistic approach when setting objectives (this needs some improvements to work as intended), saves hours of manually make a plan for each rider.
- Workshop makes it easier to download community made databases and expansion packs (this needs some improvements to work as intended).

Cons:
- We have to wait until every feature as promised and as intended will be ready.
- In their attempt to make the game easier for the casual gamer, they get rid of the more complex management tasks. Why aren't they making it optional to use the old objectives system?

review:
Mais ou est donc passé l'editeur d'étapes ainsi que l'éditeur de DB ?
Comment créer des étapes sauf en ce servant et si c'est compabible des autres opus 2013 à 2015 ?
Cyanide nous à pondu une version sous lequel ils ont enlevés les pilliers de cette séries qui régne sur le monde du management depuis 2001 année de sortie et depuis 2011 année de la création de l'éditeur d'étapes.
Ils nous ont enlevé le charme de la créativité, et ils nous laissent juste le squellette sans aucun os à ronger comme le plaisir de faire courir les artistes de la péadale dans les étapes que nous avons fait naître.
C'est quoi cette nulisime version de PCM ?
C'est vaste, sans aucun gout !.....regardez cette pochette sous lequel ont ne peu savoir qui la représente ?
Beaucoup disent.....mais c'est Froome !....heu achetez vous des lunettes les amie(s) car même la "mère denis" aurait eu aussi grâce de présence, que l'ont aurait pu au moins, la distinguer !
Pire, les commentaires n'ont pas évoluer depuis 2007 !!!....et beaucoup d'autres que je signifirait pas,car ce serait inutile.
Le moteur qui ce doit d'être un bon en avant, à eu effet juste sur le terme graphisme avec les 11 Go que prenne le jeu sur un disque dur,mais dans le fond, c'est en dessous de toutes espérences !
PCM 2016, est sans conteste la versions interdite à la consommation, et qui est même la pire des franchises et ceux depuis 2013.
Au moins sur les autres opus, nous avions un large choix présenté, comme la possibilité de pouvoir créer une database perso et une équipe, mais la ce PCM version "je te vend juste pour me faire du fric" est la plus radicale vente absurde que même sur un vide grenier, nous voudrions le vendre à 5 centimes qu'il ne partirait pas !
Allez comme c'est bientôt le tour en ce jour du 29 Juin 2016, je vais terminer ma grande déception de cette sortie par "aller quintana" !

author: {'steamid': '76561198050294120', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 4938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1469834387}
review:
Que dire de plus si ce n'est qu'on a encore l'impression que le jeu n'évolue pas, hormis quelques changements (en bien ou en mal) comme l'interface en course, le planning du mode carrière, le mode pro cyclist.

Pour quelqu'un comme moi qui porte d'abord l'attention sur le comportement en course, c'est toujours la douche froide, avec (en difficile) ... :
- une caméra toujours foireuse (on se mange tous les arbres sur les ascensions pour peu que l'on veuille voir autre chose que les fesses d'un coureur), 
- des équipiers incapables de se gérer un minimum tout seul, avec par exemple notre leader qui ne suit pas le train des équipiers en tête de peloton et se retrouve largué si on ne porte pas attention,
- une absence d'évolutions majeures et qui pourrait aider un peu le joueur, sans tricher pour autant : possibilité d'avoir de l'écran dans l'écran, pour suivre deux coureurs, voir de rembobiner une action si on n'était pas sur le coureur à un moment donné
- des sprints bizarres, comme le maillot vert où seul un ou deux coureurs sprintent pour les points intermédiaires,
- des formes du jour assez cheatées, ou un gars avec 76 en montagne peut suivre les leaders sans problème si il a une forme positive
- l'interface en course encore une fois modifiée (pourquoi ??), avec des couleurs de partout, de la transparence foutoire, des bidons au design complètement raté, et au final un beau sapin de noel,
- un mode carte mal réalisé, qui ne permet pas de savoir exactement où l'on se trouve, par exemple pour les pourcentages d'ascension d'un col. Un zoom est dispo mais n'apporte rien en fait, car pas de localisation.
- il faut des plombes pour remonter le peloton, notre coureur étant souvent coincé au centre de la route. Facile pour se faire largué facilement, même en côte ou le peloton est normalement beaucoup plus étiré.
- un mode difficile mal équilibré où les étapes de montagne se finisse en peloton de tête de 50 coureurs.
- etc etc

Le mode carrière a l'air d'avoir stagné, et le peu de modifications apportent plus de problèmes qu'autre chose... Un mode de planning complètement incompréhensible pour nous les joueurs (et peu réaliste).

Je passe sur les défauts récurrents, comme le peu d'aide générale, la notice qui se résume à un feuillet,  etc

Bref, le peu de nouveautés apportées ne servent vraiment pas à grand chose, et il n'y a clairement aucunes innovations intelligentes cette année. Le jeu fait clairement du surplace... même menus, même plans de caméra, même commentateurs, même défauts d'équilibrage, mêmes options, mêmes licences manquantes... Bref, un développement à bas coût pour des profits certainement confortables, et un statut de monopole continu.

review:
First off: I really, really like the game. It's all cycling-lovers have and riding stages is a great experience. Unfortunately, that's where the fun ends.

Why I do not recommend the game:

1. Crashes, many other reviews already mention it, the game has been up for nearly a year and it still has the amount of crashes you would expect from a game in early beta. It is at an unacceptable level, such that I wonder if it's even responsible for steam to offer the game, as you're buying a flawed product.

2. The management part of the game lacks, the interface is clumsy to use, for example if you want to assign cyclists to a training camp you're unable to see the breakdown of the cyclists (which is very annoying if your starting a low level squad with many unknown cyclists). Generally there are just not many things you can influence from a manager's perspective on the long run.

Concluding: I love the concept of a cycling manager game, however the game is a faulty product which feels like it's in beta. This is unacceptable for such a long running series. Cyanide needs to step it up and make their game actually playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041482240', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1489089898}
review:
After my problems at the release of the game (The game didn't launch the whole launch day and i only got it fixed the day after) I have been enjoying the game a lot.

If you are a cycling enthousiast looking for a game to play of the sport you love, then this might just be your game. For other spports fans, i'm not so sure. The game is very complicated in some aspects, and can often seem quite confusing for people not watching real life cycling.

The game is enjoyable and has a large learning curve. There is a high ceiling for skill level, as the possibilities of strategies are ENDLESS. This can also been as one of the biggest weaknesses of this game though. Because this game can be very confusing and complicated for some people, it can draw people away from playing this game. Most of all people that have no clue what they are doing. (Attacking with their riders from the start and such).

Overall this new edition of the pro cycling manager series has seen minor but great improvements. 

Would i recommend it to people who have never bought a PCM game? Yes. 
Would i recommend it to people who bought PCM15? Not as much. 
There are only minor improvements to the gameplay (New hud design, which is amazing btw, small improvements to career and pro cyclist), as the biggest change was the overhaul in the online mode. 
Would i recommend the game to people who skipped PCM15? Yes.
The new pro cyclist mode has been improved, and as for that the game can be a total bombshell of new experiences.

So to conclude, i would recommend this game, but only if you know what you are doing and what you need to do in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999557786', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1542729255}
review:
New season, same problems. 
I cannot play the game due a creation of profile bug. I don´t know if is it a problem to test the game before launch. Idiots from Cyanide...I don´t know what else I should said about that.

*** UPDATED ***

It finally works. I start a game on Sunday morning (when the servers aren´t busy) and I can create the profile.
So take a look on the gameplay:

+
Graphic - it looks very good and much better than the previous versions
3D race interface
Pro cyclist mode - I don´t like it, but for someone could be fun

- 
Objective problem - The main problem for career
At the start of the season in career mode the game choose me the leaders of my team. I could set them the objectives according them the fitness schedule is made. I set them the domestiques for key racing of the season at that´s the start of the problem. For a better understanding please let me explain:
Leader A has a domestiques 1,2,3 - goals are Tour Down Under/Giro/something
Leader B has a domestiques 4,5,6 - goals are Tirreno/Tour de France/something
According that the fitness schedule is made...
but when I need to put the domestiques no. 1 from leader A to domestiques for leader B, the fitness schedule for this domestique no. 1 remains the same. He should have a good fitness for Tour de France, but his schedule is made by AI for Giro. I cannot change it manually.
I think that it doesn´t have any sense. The career mode is unplayable at the moment with this bug. 
In 3D race I found a problem with order to hold position, because sometimes the rider slip away to back of the peloton without any reason - during the easy pace
Some problems with DB - for expample Nibali has ACC 50 :-D WTF? 

Overall, the game has a lot of bugs, and I think something cannot be fixed by patches. I spent 30 Euros for this game and it´s on of the worst purchase which I ever made.
I played all PCM from 2006 to 2014, last year I rather wait for 2016 version.

If I could recommend something, wait for a patches and look on PCMDaily if the game will be debuged, otherwise it´s a waste of money. What a shame :-(


*** UPDATE***
The game is patched by Patch 1.1.0.3 which fix the schedule problem now. There are still some problems with hold positions and with Nibali ACC is still 50 (WFT? :-D), but hey the game is running now good and I think it´s a playable at the moment. I´m looking for some PCM daily DB with real equipment which improves the game a lot :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004635221', 'num_games_owned': 4644, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3469, 'last_played': 1493914052}
review:
I am very glad that new PCM has so much improvements!
Cyanide made great work with game. so we are recieving the best PCM we had, I can say that as owner of all Cycling Manager games from CM 1 to 2012 in boxes, and then in Steam. I can compare, and we got almost ideal game.
+ Better graphics, so close to Le Tour of consoles.
+ Better AI in mountains, sprint trains, and breakaway.
+ Much more interesting controlling in Pro Cyclist Mode, when you are leader of team.
+ Brand new multiplayer mode. There is no more Armada mode. You can play multiplayer as before, real teams, real cyclists, and the main feature, that it is almost lag-free multiplayer!
+ Some interesting improvements in pre-race HUD, magazine, interview etc.
+ New HUD in race, which I like more than previous, it is more useful and friendly.
+ Steam Workshop support. It will be much more easier to install and publish modes.
The problems, or minuses are the same:
- Not fully licensed game, BUT, but it is fixing in one-two day on forums, all you need is fixing: names, shirts, bikes, wheels, etc.
- Some rare crashes, but most of them will be fixed in two-three patches.
- Little problems with optimization, but much more better than in PCM 2015. I have stable 30-40 FPS on maximum settings on HD7970.
So, this is what I waited for, the same PCM, with new graphics, improvements in AI and career modes. And of course simplier multiplayer. This is great opportunity to buy the game.
Cycling as a passion, love cycling, watch cycling, play cycling!
